title: Senior Fullstack utvecklare
description:
- **Vill du vara med på resan när vi startar upp vår Creative tech enhet i Göteborg? Vill du arbeta tillsammans med inspirerande, glada och kompetenta kollegor i ett av Göteborgs mest innovativa och centrala nav kring mjukvaruutveckling? Söker du en roll där du som konsult får vara med och skapa innovativa digitala produkter?**  



**Om rollen**  

Som fullstack-utvecklare kommer du att bidra med att bygga högkvalitativa lösningar och stabil kodbas till våra kunder som förser dem med verkligt affärsvärde. Att vara en del av ett team innebär delat ägandeskap och ansvar och vi förväntar oss att du är del av utvecklingsprocessen samtidigt som du tillför din expertis inom till exempel cloudlösningar, databas-migreringar, frontend-utveckling eller dev-ops.


***För denna roll krävs det att du är flytande i det svenska språket i tal och skrift, observera att vi endast beaktar sökande med giltigt arbetsvisum och kvalificerade arbetstillstånd.***  



**Vad förväntar vi oss av dig?**  

För att lyckas i rollen som fullstack-utvecklare tror vi att du är öppen för att möta nya idéer och är flexibel när det kommer till att möta nya utmaningar. Du njuter av samarbete och är bekväm med att dela med dig av din kunskap till kollegor och kunder. För att lyckas i rollen och på Devoteam Creative Tech tror vi även att du är ödmjuk och har en lösningsfokuserad approach.  

  




	* Teknisk expertis: Ungefär 5 års erfarenhet av fullstackutveckling
	* God vana av att skriva testbar och skalbar kod i React eller Vue, TypeScript/Javascript, Node.js
	* Erfarenhet av backend-språk och plattformar som Node.js, Go, Java eller .Net/ C#
	* Förstå värdet av kodgranskning och dess funktion i mjukvaruutveckling
	* God förståelse och erfarenhet av designa och utveckla API:er
	* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila teams
	* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnbaserade lösningar som AWS, GCP eller Azure
	* Relationsdatabaser och NoSQL
	* Bekväm i att hålla djupa tekniska diskussioner på Svenska och Engelska
	* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift**Även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:**


	* Mjukvaruarkitektur (exempelvis event-baserad arkitektur)
	* CI/CD pipelines
	* Data engineering (exempelvis datamodellering, ETL, etc)**Arbetsplats**  

Arbetsplatsen för den här rollen är Göteborg med omnejd.  

  



**Om Devoteam**  

Hos oss värderar vi medarbetarnas trivsel och utveckling högt. Vi har byggt en arbetskultur där människor känner sig inspirerade, utmanade och trygga. Vi tror att när du trivs och växer, så gör även våra lösningar det.


Vi är ett ledande IT-konsultföretag med en stark förankring i Malmös och Halmstad tech-community, både som Devoteam och f.d .Jayway. Nu ska vi äntligen etablera oss i Göteborg. Vi är engagerade i att skapa långsiktiga relationer med både kunder och medarbetare. Vi drivs av en passion för teknik och innovation, och erbjuder skräddarsydda lösningar för företag inom en rad olika branscher. Bland våra initiativ kan nämnas Øredev , en av Skandinaviens största utvecklarkonferenser, som vi var med och grundade.


**Förmåner och praktisk information:**


	* Kontinuerligt lärande: Vi stöder kontinuerligt lärande med kompetensgrupper varannan vecka, deltagande på Øredev och löpande kompetensdagar för din professionella utveckling. Du har möjlighet att ta certifikat med någon av våra partners (AWS, Azure, GCP).
	* Ledighet och pension: Vi erbjuder 30 dagars semester, kompletterande föräldraledighetsersättning och tjänstepension enligt ITP1.
	* Hälsa och välbefinnande: Självklara förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, tillgång till företagshälsovård, hälsokontroller och lunchyoga på kontoret.
	* Verktyg och utrustning: Du väljer själv de verktyg du behöver för att leverera och trivas i din arbetsmiljö.**Ansökan**  

För att ansöka, vänligen skicka din ansökan via länken nedan. Vi uppmuntrar tidiga ansökningar eftersom vi granskar dem löpande.


För eventuella frågor, kontakta Sanna Ekelöf, vår rekryterare, på sanna.ekelof@devoteam.com. Sanna kommer att vara din primära kontaktperson under hela rekryteringsprocessen.

title: Senior backendutvecklare - Java
description:
- **Vill du vara med på resan när vi startar upp vår Creative tech enhet i Göteborg? Vill du arbeta tillsammans med inspirerande, glada och kompetenta kollegor i ett av Göteborgs mest innovativa och centrala nav kring mjukvaruutveckling? Söker du en roll där du som konsult får vara med och skapa innovativa digitala produkter?**

**Om rollen**  

Som senior Java-utvecklare får du möjligheten att vara med i utvecklingen av robusta och skalbara system som driver affärskritiska applikationer. Du kommer att arbeta med Java SE/EE, Spring Framework/Spring Boot, molnlösningar (AWS, GCP, Azure), API-design, microservices och containerbaserade arkitekturer (Docker, Kubernetes).


***För denna roll krävs det att du är flytande i det svenska språket i tal och skrift, observera att vi endast beaktar sökande med giltigt arbetsvisum och kvalificerade arbetstillstånd.***  



**Vad förväntar vi oss av dig?**  




	* Teknisk expertis: Ungefär 5 års erfarenhet av backendutveckling, molnbaserade system och erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code.
	* Kommunikationsförmåga: Du kan effektivt kommunicera komplexa tekniska lösningar till olika intressenter.
	* Problemlösare: Du har en analytisk förmåga och kan tänka strategiskt för att hitta de bästa lösningarna.
	* Ledarskap: Du är en informell ledare som inspirerar och stöttar dina kollegor.
	* Teamspelare: Du trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
	* Språk: Du är flytande i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.**Arbetsplats**  

Arbetsplatsen för den här rollen är Göteborg med omnejd.  

  



**Om Devoteam**  

Hos oss värderar vi medarbetarnas trivsel och utveckling högt. Vi har byggt en arbetskultur där människor känner sig inspirerade, utmanade och trygga. Vi tror att när du trivs och växer, så gör även våra lösningar det.


Vi är ett ledande IT-konsultföretag med en stark förankring i Malmös och Halmstad tech-community, både som Devoteam och f.d .Jayway. Nu ska vi äntligen etablera oss i Göteborg. Vi är engagerade i att skapa långsiktiga relationer med både kunder och medarbetare. Vi drivs av en passion för teknik och innovation, och erbjuder skräddarsydda lösningar för företag inom en rad olika branscher. Bland våra initiativ kan nämnas Øredev , en av Skandinaviens största utvecklarkonferenser, som vi var med och grundade.


**Förmåner och praktisk information:**


	* Kontinuerligt lärande: Vi stöder kontinuerligt lärande med kompetensgrupper varannan vecka, deltagande på Øredev och löpande kompetensdagar för din professionella utveckling. Du har möjlighet att ta certifikat med någon av våra partners (AWS, Azure, GCP).
	* Ledighet och pension: Vi erbjuder 30 dagars semester, kompletterande föräldraledighetsersättning och tjänstepension enligt ITP1.
	* Hälsa och välbefinnande: Självklara förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, tillgång till företagshälsovård, hälsokontroller och lunchyoga på kontoret.
	* Verktyg och utrustning: Du väljer själv de verktyg du behöver för att leverera och trivas i din arbetsmiljö.**Ansökan**  

För att ansöka, vänligen skicka din ansökan via länken nedan. Vi uppmuntrar tidiga ansökningar eftersom vi granskar dem löpande.


För eventuella frågor, kontakta Sanna Ekelöf, vår rekryterare, på sanna.ekelof@devoteam.com. Sanna kommer att vara din primära kontaktperson under hela rekryteringsprocessen.

Vill du arbeta tillsammans med inspirerande, glada och kompetenta kollegor i ett av Göteborgs mest innovativa och centrala nav kring mjukvaruutveckling? Söker du en roll där du som konsult får vara med och skapa innovativa digitala produkter?**

**Om rollen**  

Som .Net-utvecklare kommer du att bidra med att bygga högkvalitativa lösningar och stabil kodbas till våra kunder som förser dem med verkligt affärsvärde. Att vara en del av ett team innebär delat ägandeskap och ansvar och vi förväntar oss att du är del av utvecklingsprocessen samtidigt som du tillför din expertis inom till exempel cloudlösningar, databas-migreringar, frontend-utveckling eller dev-ops.

title: Backend Developer
description:
**Why Dashy?**


We believe in creating meaningful and memorable digital experiences that leave lasting impressions. As a consultant at Dashy, you will get the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring digital entertainment companies in the world, within fields such as gaming, media streaming and other immersive experiences. We strive to work with clients that build products and services that they, and we, can be truly proud of.


At Dashy our people are always in the center - together we build and grow the company with happiness as our guiding principle. We enable growth and personal development, with collaboration and knowledge-sharing as an integral part in everything we do.

**As a Backend Developer at Dashy:**

* Dive deep into the world of digital entertainment, designing, developing and iterating on systems and features.
* Collaborate with a vibrant cross-functional team, including developers, designers, producers, product managers, and more.
* Support other colleagues in their growth and with their challenges.
* Help build and grow Dashy.

**We're looking for:**

* 3-7 years of experience as a Backend Developer.
* Strong experience with backend services using languages such as Java/Spring, Golang, Python, C#/.NET, or JavaScript/TypeScript (NestJS, Express).
* Solid understanding of database systems, data modeling, and query optimization.
* Proficient in designing and implementing RESTful APIs and/or RPC APIs.
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), including serverless architectures, IAM, and cloud databases.
* Familiarity with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and microservices architecture.
* Knowledge of common engineering practices such as CI/CD pipelines, version control (Git), and automated testing.
* Experience in AI-enhanced workflows (e.g. Claude, Co-Pilot, ChatGPT etc).
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
* A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.
* Passion for continuous learning and mentoring others.
* Genuine interest in games, music, and interactive media.

**What we offer:**

* Working with some of the most inspiring tech companies with a global footprint.
* Office in central Stockholm with hybrid setup.
* Structured mentorship program, tailored for each individual.
* Competitive salary, occupational pension and wellness allowance.
* Yearly company summits.
* Strong group of passionate individuals, team activities and collaborative environment.

Nurture your passion for technology and entertainment, and turn it into a fulfilling career with us at Dashy Studios!

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
As a Full Stack Developer in our Procurement Team, you’ll play a key role in improving one of the most business critical parts of Proceedo. the flow where thousands of users create, manage, and confirm their purchases every day. If you want to work end-to-end, learn fast, and build meaningful features in a large-scale SaaS product, this is the place.
   

  

 This role uniquely combines test automation and full stack development, giving you a rare opportunity to understand the system deeply while growing your technical skills with the support of an experienced team.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 To continue developing and improving our service, we are now looking for a full stack developer to join our Procurement Team. A typical week mixes front-end and back-end development, along with smart test automation.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

* Build and maintain features in both Java and Angular
* Write automated tests using the Java RestAssured
* Contribute to key flows in Proceedo such as requisitions, orders, confirmations, and supplier interactions
* Collaborate closely with your teammates to deliver stable, scalable solutions
* Continuously improve our processes, code base, and technical foundations


 You’ll start by focusing on automated tests and smaller development tasks—supported by the team—before taking on broader and more complex areas.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We’re looking for a developer with a few years of hands-on development experience who wants to grow into a full-fledged full stack developer.
   

  

 You have:
   

  

* Experience working with Java and angular
* Experience working in agile teams and with modern development tools (Git, REST, OOP)
* A relevant education, such as a bachelor’s degree in computer science (or equivalent)
* A proven interest in AI and curiosity about new tools and technologies
* Familiarity with writing automated tests (RestAssured is a plus)


 You don't need to know everything from day one, we are looking for a colleague with a curiosity, the ability to learn quickly, and a drive to build high-quality software.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re structured in your work and good at organizing your tasks. Switching between writing automated tests and building new features requires planning and follow-through, and you enjoy working in a way that keeps things moving.
   

  

 We will carry out background checks on applicants to verify information that appears on CVs and other documentation. This background check is carried out by an external party and is not carried out without the consent of the applicant.
   

  

**Why Proceedo?**
 This is an exceptional place to grow as a developer. Because you’ll work with both automation and development, you’ll learn faster than in many traditional roles.
   

  

 At Proceedo, we’re kind to each other. We work hard, but we also respect your personal time. You get the stability and benefits of a large company like Visma, combined with a small-team feeling where your ideas matter and your work has a clear impact.
   

  

 Our leadership is supportive, we collaborate openly, and we continuously explore new technologies to build a smarter, more scalable product.
   

  

 If you want to join a team that values craft, clarity, and curiosity and you’re ready to grow your skills in a real SaaS environment we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 We will carry out background checks on applicants to verify information that appears on CVs and other documentation. The check is performed by an external partner and only with the applicant’s consent.
   

  

**About the company:**
***Vilka är vi på Visma Proceedo?***
*Vi är ett företag som är med och formar vårt samhälles framtid. I Visma globalt är vi över 14 000 medarbetare som brinner för att utveckla världsledande molntjänster. Hos oss på Visma Proceedo, som en del av Visma, är vi 100 engagerade medarbetare fokuserade på vår produkt. Vi är ett familjärt och vänligt företag som värdesätter entreprenörskap, där många trivs och ofta stannar i många år.*
**Do you want to know more about career opportunities?** 
 Check out our website: https://careers.visma.com/ or the website of
 **[ORGANISATION]** 
 via
 **[WEBSITE]** 
 .

title: Backend Developer Intern
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Backend Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in
 **API development, system integration, and backend architecture** 
 .
 



 This is a
 **remote, hands-on role** 
 where you will work closely with experienced developers to design, implement, and maintain backend services that support our AR platforms.
 



 While this is initially
 **unpaid** 
 , exceptional performance may lead to a
 **paid position** 
 after the internship.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Own and evolve core backend services powering our AR platform
* Design and build scalable REST APIs using
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js**
* Architect and optimize
 **PostgreSQL** 
 databases for performance and reliability
* Integrate backend systems with clients and
 **ML pipelines**
* Make pragmatic architecture decisions that balance speed and scalability
* Build, review, and maintain clean, production-ready code
* Lead backend best practices, mentor teammates, and raise the engineering bar
* Work closely with founders, product, and AR teams to ship features fast
* Help shape cloud infrastructure and deployments on
 **AWS**



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Strong hands-on experience with
 **Node.js** 
 ,
 **Express.js** 
 ,
 **JavaScript** 
 , and
 **TypeScript**
* Deep understanding of
 **PostgreSQL** 
 , schema design, and performance tuning
* Experience running production systems on
 **AWS**
* Comfort working in fast-moving, ambiguous environments
* Strong Git workflow experience (Bitbucket or similar)
* Solid understanding of backend security and system reliability
* Ability to take ownership, make decisions, and execute independently
* **Bonus:** 
 Experience with
 **Sequelize** 
 ,
 **microservices, or ML/AR system integration**



  





**What You’ll Gain:** 



* Real ownership over critical systems — not just tickets
* Exposure to
 **AWS-based scalable architectures**
* Experience with
 **industrial-grade API design, testing, and security**
* Direct impact in a
 **live product launch**
* Work on cutting-edge AR + ML technology



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Are you a ready to use your skills for something that truly matters? Maybe you’ve built countless apps, optimized endless user flows, or maintained systems that never quite made a difference in people’s lives. Now, imagine putting your skills to work for something bigger - something that actually changes how healthcare, social services, and elderly care work together in Sweden.
   

  

 We’re building a next-generation platform that will transform collaboration across these vital sectors. We are now looking for experienced Fullstack Developers, who are ready to use their craft to make a real impact.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
* Meaningful mission: Directly influence the future of Swedish healthcare and social services.
* Technical Leadership: Take ownership of architecture, drive technical decisions, and mentor colleagues.
* Modern tech & AI: Work with React, TypeScript, Java, Spring Boot, Docker, Kubernetes and AI-driven development.
* Growth & collaboration: Learn from talented colleagues and have access to mentorship and growth opportunities.
* Flexible culture: Enjoy flexible working conditions and a friendly culture built on trust and care.


**The position**
 You’ll be part of an agile and innovative team, contributing throughout the entire development lifecycle — from requirements to production-ready services. Depending on your experience, you’ll either grow into the role or take a lead in driving development and mentoring others.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Develop and maintain a modern, API-first platform using test-driven and AI-assisted methods.
* Mentor and support other developers, fostering a culture of technical excellence.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (designers, product owners, domain experts) to deliver secure, scalable, and user-friendly solutions.
* Contribute to architectural decisions for scalability, performance, and security
* Stay at the forefront of technology and share your expertise with the team.


**About You**
 You are curious, eager to learn, and enjoy working with others. You thrive in an environment where you can grow your skills step by step, contribute with your ideas, and collaborate to solve problems together.
   

  

 At Cambio, we value initiative and personal growth. Our culture is built on Trust, Care, and Together values we believe are important to both our work and our people. It’s important to us that you recognize and identify with these values.
   

  

**Requirements**
* A passionate engineer with 5+ years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* Curiosity about AI and enthusiasm for exploring new technologies.
* Communicates fluently in Swedish and English


**It's a bonus**
* Experience working in our tech stack


**Additional Information**
**Place of employment** 
 : Linköping, Motala or Stockholm
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)
   

  

**Form of employment** 
 : Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

 We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 As a Software Engineer at Legora, you’ll play a key role in building the technical foundation that powers our products, designing, developing, and improving the core systems used by legal professionals around the world. You’ll work across the stack, contributing to the architecture and features that define our platform.
   

  

* This is a Stockholm-based, 5-day in-office role, we believe building together in person drives better outcomes.


**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead the design, development, and deployment of end-to-end features for our web platform, ensuring high performance, security, and reliability.
* Take full ownership of critical parts of the codebase, balancing quality, scalability, and speed of development.
* Work with technologies such as React, Node.js, AWS, Azure, and Kubernetes, leveraging the right tools to solve complex challenges.
* Collaborate closely with product and design teams to translate requirements into elegant, robust technical solutions.
* Review code and mentor colleagues, raising the overall technical bar and fostering a culture of excellence.
* Drive continuous improvement by challenging assumptions, exploring new technologies, and pushing both yourself and the team to innovate.
* Contribute to infrastructure, integrations, and architecture discussions to ensure the platform evolves sustainably.


**Who You Are**
* An engineer with experience building and shipping modern software products.
* Comfortable working across the stack, with solid skills in backend development.
* Passionate about writing maintainable, secure code—and take pride in building things that last.
* A problem solver who enjoys thinking about architecture, data flows, and long-term sustainability.
* Familiar with cloud infrastructure, distributed systems, and integrations (experience with enterprise-scale systems is a plus, but not required).
* Proactive, curious, and motivated by working in a fast-paced, collaborative startup environment.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Solution developer with a passion for Fullstack| SEB, Solna
description:
Are you our new Solution Developer? As a Solution Developer within Core and Internal Digital Channels, you will be driving the Internet banks digital transformation by building its new future platform. This is a great opportunity to try out new technologies and drive change in a team with talented and experienced colleagues!
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this position you will work in an autonomous agile team filled with competent frontend and backend developers, product owner, tech lead, CX designer and scrum master. Together you are responsible for the internet banks technichal plattform, built using a shell and micro frontend architecture. Collaboration cross teams will be part of your daily work and together with your colleagues you will shape a platform used by a broad variety of users
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* At least 3 years of experience in .Net based Microservices
* Hands on experience of SQL and Mongo database
* Have worked with JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular or Node. It’s a plus if you have worked with module federation.
* Curiosity, be motivated by competence development and the ability to take initiative.
* Experience from Kubernetes and Cloud Services
* Experience with Github action and CI/CD
* Experience from working in a microservice and micro frontend-based software architecture, cloud solutions, network handling, firewalls and load balancing is meritorious


**What We Offer**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* An innovative company in the forefront or technology
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today. If you have questions about the position, please contact Marcus Coutinho via mail Marcus.Coutinho@seb.se
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Svea Solar is on the verge of transforming how we manage energy with just the click of a button. We're here to help our customers make the most of their energy usage while also balancing the energy grid with smart, innovative solutions. To bring this vision to life, we're expanding our engineering team and are on the lookout for our next Backend Engineer.
   

  

**About The Role & The Team**
 As a Backend Engineer, you'll join our Sunbeam Labs, where we’re creating digital services that range from energy optimization to virtual power plants. You’ll work closely with a talented and energetic team of engineers and domain experts, all focused on building cutting-edge software solutions that make energy optimization a reality for our customers.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll be involved in every stage of the software development lifecycle, from brainstorming ideas to deployment and ongoing maintenance. Since we’re pioneering services that haven’t existed before, there’s plenty of room for discovery and problem-solving! You’ll be working with thousands of connected devices that we control in real-time, based on measurements taken multiple times per second. Your daily challenges might include figuring out how to distribute work among devices, handling AWS datacenter failovers without a hitch, counting milliseconds and megawatts, and even predicting tomorrow’s sunshine.
   

  

 If you love tackling challenges, writing code, and having fun while doing it, this could be the
   

  

 perfect fit for you!
   

  

 🌍 Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you
   

  

**The opportunity to make an impact** 
 – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.
   

  

**About**
**A value-driven workplace** 
 – read more about our values here.
   

  

**The chance to own your results** 
 – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusivity** 
 – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.
   

  

**Employment benefits** 
 – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.
   

  

**Flexibility / hybrid work** 
 – work up to two days a week from home.
   

  

 Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar
   

  

 Are we a match?
   

  

 At Svea Solar, we’re all about our values, and we want to make sure they resonate with you too. We’re looking for a Backend Engineer who’s not just experienced, but who’s also passionate about end-to-end development. We’re less concerned with how many years you’ve been working and more interested in your skills, mindset, and enthusiasm. You should be comfortable with architecture styles and APIs (like REST or RPC) and have strong communication skills with a proactive attitude.
   

  

**Here’s what we’re looking for:**
* You value team success over personal success.
* Experience as a Backend Developer (preferably with .NET)
* A solid understanding of architecture styles and APIs
* Great communication skills


**Bonus points if you have:**
* Knowledge of cloud technologies (we use AWS)
* Experience in the energy sector
* Experience with Kubernetes and Docker
* Experience with time series databases
* Experience working with physical devices


 We are a hybrid team that meets at our office in Alvik Strand 3 times a week.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to meet you! Join us on our mission to revolutionize home energy solutions and create a greener, more sustainable future.
   

  

 ⚡Who are we
   

  

 As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it
 **The Power Shift** 
 . And the ones driving it?
 **Power Shifters** 
 .
   

  

  

  

**About Our Recruitment Process**
* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.


 👉
 **Ready to become a Power Shifter?** 
 We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Svea Solar is on the verge of transforming how we manage energy with just the click of a button. We're here to help our customers make the most of their energy usage while also balancing the energy grid with smart, innovative solutions. To bring this vision to life, we're expanding our engineering team and are on the lookout for our next Backend Engineer.
   

  

**About The Role & The Team**
 As a Backend Engineer, you'll join our Sunbeam Labs, where we’re creating digital services that range from energy optimization to virtual power plants. You’ll work closely with a talented and energetic team of engineers and domain experts, all focused on building cutting-edge software solutions that make energy optimization a reality for our customers.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll be involved in every stage of the software development lifecycle, from brainstorming ideas to deployment and ongoing maintenance. Since we’re pioneering services that haven’t existed before, there’s plenty of room for discovery and problem-solving! You’ll be working with thousands of connected devices that we control in real-time, based on measurements taken multiple times per second. Your daily challenges might include figuring out how to distribute work among devices, handling AWS datacenter failovers without a hitch, counting milliseconds and megawatts, and even predicting tomorrow’s sunshine.
   

  

 If you love tackling challenges, writing code, and having fun while doing it, this could be the
   

  

 perfect fit for you!
   

  

 🌍 Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you
   

  

**The opportunity to make an impact** 
 – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.
   

  

**About**
**A value-driven workplace** 
 – read more about our values here.
   

  

**The chance to own your results** 
 – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusivity** 
 – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.
   

  

**Employment benefits** 
 – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.
   

  

**Flexibility / hybrid work** 
 – work up to two days a week from home.
   

  

 Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar
   

  

 Are we a match?
   

  

 At Svea Solar, we’re all about our values, and we want to make sure they resonate with you too. We’re looking for a Backend Engineer who’s not just experienced, but who’s also passionate about end-to-end development. We’re less concerned with how many years you’ve been working and more interested in your skills, mindset, and enthusiasm. You should be comfortable with architecture styles and APIs (like REST or RPC) and have strong communication skills with a proactive attitude.
   

  

**Here’s What We’re Looking For**
* You value team success over personal success.
* Experience as a Backend Developer (preferably with .NET)
* A solid understanding of architecture styles and APIs
* Great communication skills


**Bonus Points If You Have**
* Knowledge of cloud technologies (we use AWS)
* Experience in the energy sector
* Experience with Kubernetes and Docker
* Experience with time series databases
* Experience working with physical devices


 We are a hybrid team that meets at our office in Alvik Strand 3 times a week.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to meet you! Join us on our mission to revolutionize home energy solutions and create a greener, more sustainable future.
   

  

 ⚡Who are we
   

  

 As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it
 **The Power Shift** 
 . And the ones driving it?
 **Power Shifters** 
 .
   

  

  

  

**About Our Recruitment Process**
* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.


 👉
 **Ready to become a Power Shifter?** 
 We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!

title: AI Developer
description:
**AI DEVELOPER**
 Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? At Permobil, we’re looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.
   

  

 At
 **Permobil** 
 , the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are building an intelligent AI platform on Microsoft Azure to transform how our teams work, learn, and deliver value. As an
 **AI Developer** 
 , you will design and implement secure, real-time backend systems that connect large language models, knowledge graphs, and business applications. Collaborating with integration developers, data scientists, and product teams, you will help turn innovative ideas into scalable, production-ready AI features within the Azure ecosystem, empowering our teams and driving intelligent automation across the organization.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain scalable Python microservices, deployed in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) or App Services,
* Implement retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines leveraging Azure OpenAI Service, Cognitive Search, and Azure Storage,
* Build and optimize integrations with Azure Machine Learning, AI Foundry, and Microsoft Fabric datasets,
* Collaborate with integration developers to securely expose LLM-driven functions and actions via Azure API Management,
* Work with MLOps engineers to automate model deployment, evaluation, and monitoring,
* Contribute to internal SDKs and libraries for prompt orchestration, embeddings, and evaluation.


**Qualifications & Skills**
* Master/Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or similar education,
* 3+ years of professional Python development experience,
* Strong understanding of Azure services (App Services, Key Vault, Storage, Service Bus, OpenAI),
* Experience with LangChain, Semantic Kernel, or other orchestration frameworks,
* Familiarity with vector databases such as Azure AI Search, Pinecone, or Redis Vector,
* Solid grasp of asynchronous programming, REST API design, and OAuth 2.0 / Entra ID authentication,
* Working knowledge of CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions),
* Experience in agile methodologies,
* Fluent in English; proficiency in Swedish is a plus.


**Meriting Skills**
* Experience with Azure ML or MLOps pipelines,
* Background in prompt engineering, model evaluation, or RAG optimization,
* Knowledge of data governance and responsible-AI best practices.


**Who are you?**
 You inspire and motivate those around you, while encouraging collaboration and clear communication with stakeholders at all levels. You actively support experimentation and see failure as a valuable learning opportunity, helping to create an environment where curiosity and continuous improvement thrive.
   

  

**Why is Permobil the next step for you?**
* You’ll make a difference. Every day. Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
* You’ll make your mark as part of our future. We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
* You’ll feel welcome from day one. We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone at Permobil cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


**Application Process**
 We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today or before
 **December 5th** 
 at the latest!
   

  

 Permobil is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals.
   

  

 For more information about the position, please contact Christoffer Stigson, Director Digital Transformation, christoffer.stigson@permobil.com
   

  

 For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com
   

  

**Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.**
**More About Permobil**
 Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.
   

  

 Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 2 000 team members in 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

title: iOS Developer - Shape Games, Stockholm or Copenhagen
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
 iOS Developer – Shape Games
   

  

 Contract type: Full time
   

  

 Location: Hybrid Working (Copenhagen office)
   

  

 Shape Games is looking for an experienced iOS Developer to join our talented team and help build world-class sports betting applications. You’ll work in a cross-functional team to craft smooth, scalable, and feature-rich iOS experiences using cutting-edge native Apple technologies.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an iOS Developer at Shape Games, you’ll be working with a team of 5–8 cross platform engineers in a trust-based, collaborative environment. You’ll be mentored regardless of your experience level to ensure a smooth onboarding and deep understanding of our modular product platform and development culture.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

  

* Participate in the development of scalable software
* Collaborate in a cross-functional team environment (5–8 engineers)
* Be able to operate in an open, inspiring and trust-based environment, where your voice will be heard in matters concerning your team
* Be assigned a mentor, regardless of your experience level, for the first weeks at work, just so you can get familiar with the product and the Shape Games ways of working
* Join us in achieving the best user experience using native technologies from Apple
* Fully embrace the Swift programming language and follow the Swift Evolution closely, taking advantage of any new features that we can see providing value
* Contribute to expand our modular architecture: this has so far resulted in more than 50 swift packages that can be combined to create highly customisable sports betting apps (we use Swift Package Manager for dependency management)
* Join us in using many exciting technologies including Reactive Programming with the framework developed by some of our colleagues, ReactiveKit (We also started using Swift Async Sequence which we see as a future of Reactive Programming in Swift)


 What we’re looking for
   

  

  

* Proven experience in developing native iOS applications using Swift and the iOS SDK
* Motivation to learn and grow within a team of experienced and passionate iOS, Android, and web developers
* Interest in design patterns and well-structured code and workflows
* Commitment to maintaining high code quality, performance, and documentation standards
* Clear, structured, and timely communication
* Adaptability to fast-changing circumstances and requirements
* Strong collaboration and teamwork mindset
* Interest in learning new things and sharing knowledge with others
* Experience working in Scrum or Agile development environments
* Comfortable collaborating with product managers, designers, and QA engineers


 Location
   

  

 Hybrid (Copenhagen office)
   

  

 Why join Shape Games?
   

  

  

* Work with modern technologies in a fast-moving iGaming industry
* Be part of a skilled, diverse, and collaborative team
* Flexible remote work options
* Competitive salary
* Relocation package


 Ready to shape the future of iOS development in iGaming?
   

  

 Apply now!
   

  

 Shape Games is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply, regardless of age, gender, religion, ethnicity, disability, or sexual orientation. We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace in accordance with Danish and EU equality standards.
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: Sr. Software Engineer - Mobile applications
description:
Meet Yubico: the creator of the most secure passkeys and leading provider of hardware authentication security keys. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and is public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. Our global customer base includes organizations of varying sizes, from large corporations such as Google, Amazon, Microsoft and Hyatt, to companies like Dyson. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA. Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative, Secure it Forward.
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:
 
  





  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. In support of this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups that foster inclusion, help build community and connection across Yubico. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work
 
 here
 
 ).
 

  





**Social Connection:
 
 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. Check out our
 
 Life at Yubico Page
 
 on LinkedIn and our awards
 
 here
 **.
 
  






 The Role:
 




  






 We are looking for a talented mobile app developer to join our team in Stockholm. You will be working with us to build mobile applications in Flutter, with native components interfacing with the platform at a lower level. While previous Flutter experience is not required, you should be motivated to learn. You should have a background in developing mobile apps for either iOS or Android, as you will also contribute native code for the platform you know best. An enthusiasm for cryptography, secure systems, and solving challenging technical problems will make you an excellent fit.
 




  






  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Design, build, and maintain mobile applications (Flutter) with native components in iOS (Swift/Objective-C) or Android (Kotlin/Java)
* Participate in architecture discussions and contribute to technical decision-making
* Debug and resolve issues across devices and platforms
* Write and maintain unit and integration tests
* Continuously learn and apply new tools, frameworks, and best practices



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* Bachelor or MS in Computer Science or a relevant technical discipline, or equivalent work experience
* Experience in building mobile apps with rich user interfaces
* Experience with native app development on iOS and/or Android
* Ability to write code that is secure, readable, testable, and easy to maintain
* Able to take initiative, maintain a positive attitude, be self-motivated, and work effectively on projects with minimal direct supervision



  




**Bonus Qualifications:** 
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Github Actions)
* Experience working with NFC/USB/Lightning communication
* Experience with cryptography (PKI, digital signatures, etc)
* Experience working with open source and the open source community
* Experience with Flutter






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.  
 



  





  




  


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.********

title: Business Developer
description:
🚀 Why BrightAnalytics?
   

  

 BrightAnalytics is one of the fastest growing fintech companies in Belgium. With our SaaS solution, we help companies automate their management reporting. As part of our European expansion, we are looking for motivated colleagues to join our Stockholm office. You’ll have the opportunity to grow and shape the future of the company in the Nordics.
   

  

 💡 What does a Business Developer do?
   

  

* You understand the requirements and needs of our prospects and introduce them to the BrightAnalytics narrative
* Mapping out business opportunities through targeted segmentation
* You expand the number of incoming leads for our Account Executives by setting up targeted sales actions (outbound sales activities, social selling, trade shows, seminars)
* Always looking for new and creative ways of increasing our name awareness
* This position is the ideal springboard to a successful B2B sales career!


**💼 What value do you bring to the sales team?**
* Holding a master’s degree, preferably in an economic area. Prior work experience is not a must
* Fluency in Swedish is essential due to the platform’s complexity, and fluency in English is a must in our international environment
* Getting energized from your communication with potential customers and from the discovery and development of business opportunities
* You have the motivation and self-reliance required to fulfill this pivotal role
* Curiosity to learning new things every day
* As part of the team you are not afraid to go the extra mile
* Comfortable in a rapidly evolving environment
* Strong interest in business, finance and new technologies


**✨ The Benefits Of Joining This Fintech Scale-up**
* You will be part of a driven, dynamic and enthusiastic team in a varied job
* Weekly internal training sessions and on-the-job coaching will teach you unique skills that will serve you well throughout your career
* We are a financially healthy scale-up with international growth ambitions
* We have an open business culture with room for personal initiative
* You will receive a competitive salary with a motivating bonus system
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Pension Plan
* Insurance (sickness, pension, TGL, TFA)
* Friday after-work drinks, legendary team-buildings, and an annual weekend with the entire BrightAnalytics team


**Ready to boost your career within fintech?**
**Apply today and grow with BrightAnalytics!**

title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
description:
**Därför är detta jobb för dig**
 Du får friheten att föreslå lösningar och arbeta med varierande projekt för att förbättra eller skapa nya produkter. Samarbete är avgörande, då du kommer att vara en del av tvärfunktionella team som löser komplexa problem. Oavsett om du arbetar med små företag som deras externa FoU eller tillhandahåller expertis till större företag, erbjuder vi tillväxt- och utvecklingsmöjligheter.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta inom affärsområdet Software & Cloud, där vi hjälper kunder att utveckla framtidssäkra, storskaliga dator- och mjukvarusystem – från inbyggda system och elektronik till datadrivna företagsapplikationer, AI och molnbaserade lösningar.
   

  

 Under de senaste åren har vi utvecklat verktyg för blodanalys, elektriska drivsystem, kontrollsystem för stora tillverkare och skapat smarta bildanalysverktyg för datorer. Vi fångar ytor i 3D med vår egen kamerateknologi, skriver mjukvara för Machine Vision-lösningar, bygger prototyper för självkörande fordon och implementerar mjukvara för att möta ökande krav på cybersäkerhet.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Du Kommer Få Arbeta i Projekt Som Passar Din Erfarenhet Och Intressen, i Våra Inhouse-team Eller Ute Hos Kund. Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Design och implementation av embedded-mjukvara i C/C++.
* Systemintegration mellan inbyggda enheter och molnplattformar.
* Kravställning, arkitektur, test och kvalitetssäkring.
* Samarbete med tvärfunktionella team inom mjukvara, hårdvara och cloud.
* Delta i seminarier, kurser och utbildningar för att kontinuerligt hålla dig uppdaterad om nya tekniker och branschtrender.
* Identifiera och implementera nya tekniker och områden att satsa på inom embedded development, inklusive cybersäkerhet, IoT och elektrifiering.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Erfarenhet av C/C++-utveckling för inbyggda system.
* Erfarenhet av produktutveckling.
* Du kommunicerar flytande på svenska och engelska.
* Minimum en kandidatexamen inom relevant område.


**En spännande resa med Knightec Group**
 Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
   

  

 Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
   

  

 För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
   

  

 Låter det som platsen för dig? Häng med på en spännande resa!
   

  

**Praktisk information**
 Detta är en anställning placerad på vårt kontor i Solna, Rättarvägen 3. Resor i tjänsten kan förekomma till våra kunder. Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2026-03-01. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Albert Lindfors, Talent Acquisition Partner. Observera att vi, på grund av GDPR, endast tar emot ansökningar via vår karriärsida.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Security Engineer (Application Security)
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The Role**
 At Legora, we prioritise security. Always.
   

  

 We are looking for Application Security Engineers who can think like an attacker, build like a developer, and operate like an SRE. In this role you will work across our whole tech stack, from our Azure cloud infrastructure, JavaScript and Python services, to our AI integrations and workflows. Your goal is to ensure everything we ship and build is secure-by-default and resilient to evolving threats.
   

  

 At Legora we don't believe that “shifting left” is sufficient, our goal is to build a secure and resilient ecosystem for our engineers so that they can build tomorrows features with confidence and speed.
   

  

* This is a Stockholm-based, 5-day in-office role, we believe building together in person drives better outcomes.


**What You Will Be Doing**
* Embed security into our software development lifecycle; conduct design reviews, threat modelling, and secure code reviews for our JavaScript and Python codebases.
* Architect and implement security controls for our cloud infrastructure, ensuring Zero Trust principles in across our networks, identities, and service-to-service communication.
* Build and maintain secure-by-default tooling, templates, and guardrails for our developers.
* Ensure our AI workflows and pipelines are secured and resilient against prompt injection, data leakage, and abuse.
* Develop and maintain vulnerability management pipelines, triaging and driving fixes with engineering teams.
* Automate security processes in CI/CD, including secret scanning, artifact signing, and policy-as-code checks.
* Partner with our information security team to ensure compliance and automate evidence collection efforts.


**Who You Are**
* You have 3+ years in Software Engineering with a strong interest in Cyber Security, and/or
* 5+ years as in Security Engineering or Product Security roles, ideally in a cloud-first, high-growth tech environment.
* You are able to produce production grade code.
* You have experience building and securing AI workflows, with an interest in adversarial AI threats and mitigations.
* You have hands-on experience securing cloud environments (Azure strongly preferred) and working with Infrastructure-as-Code (Pulumi, Terraform, or similar).
* You understand Zero Trust architecture and can design systems with identity-centric, least-privilege access controls.
* You have experience with secure SDLC practices, application security testing, and vulnerability management.
* You thrive in cross-functional work, explaining security risks to engineers, influencing design choices, and collaborating to deliver secure features on time.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Senior Python Developer
description:
Join Sii Sweden to strengthen the technical backbone of a large-scale retail platform. You’ll work in the intersection of software development, automation, and infrastructure, helping ensure reliable, secure, and efficient provisioning, deployment, and configuration management across retail and data centre environments.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with development, infrastructure, and QA/lab teams to design, maintain, and evolve the tools and systems used for repeatable deployments in distributed environments.
   

  

 Sii ensures that all employment-related decisions are made solely on the basis of qualifications, competencies, and performance. We are committed to equal treatment of all individuals, regardless of any protected characteristics, and promote a diverse and inclusive work environment.
   

  

****Your tasks****
* Building and maintaining Python-based tools and automation scripts
* Developing and improving a YAML-driven deployment and configuration framework
* Integrating and operating automation and platform components
* Supporting automation workflows for bare-metal provisioning and virtualized infrastructure
* Enabling stable and repeatable testing and deployment together with QA and lab teams
* Contributing to architectural discussions with a focus on scalability, maintainability, and security
* Sharing knowledge, supporting other engineers, and contributing to documentation and best practices


**Requirements**
* Strong experience developing in Python
* Solid Linux administration background
* Hands-on experience with configuration management and CI/CD
* Understanding of virtualization and provisioning workflows
* Good knowledge of networking fundamentals and IP management concepts
* Familiarity with identity, secrets management, and monitoring
* Fluent in English, Swedish is a plus


 Job no. 251217-5ERLQ
   

  

**Benefits For You**
 Solid financial situation
   

  

 Many experts you can learn from
   

  

 Contracts with the biggest brands
   

  

 Refferals program
   

  

 Mentoring program
   

  

 14 authentic core values
   

  

 Inclusive culture based on dialogue
   

  

 Regular integration events and trips
   

  

 Passion Sponsorship Program
   

  

 Open and accessible management team
   

  

 Profit sharing
   

  

 Welcome packs & occasional gifts

title: Snowflake Developer
description:
Snowflake Developer is responsible for designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines using Snowflake and IDMC. Build and maintain ETL/ELT workflows and data pipelines using Snowflake and IDMC to process large datasets efficiently. Design data models, create and maintain views, stored procedures, and other database objects in Snowflake, optimize data storage, and ensure scalability in Snowflake. Implement data governance, access controls, and encryption to protect sensitive information.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Analyse business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Design, develop, and implement ETL/ELT pipelines to migrate data from Teradata to Snowflake.
* Optimize migration processes ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and performance.
* Create and manage Snowflake objects (tables, views, schemas, stages, procedures).
* Implement partitioning, clustering, and performance tuning strategies.
* Implement and manage Snowflake features such as Snowpipe, Streams, Tasks, and Time Travel
* Develop and maintain data models, schemas, and stored procedures in Snowflake SQL
* Monitor and tune Snowflake performance, including warehouse sizing and query optimization and ensure efficient resource utilization and cost optimization.
* Manage external stages, storage integrations, data security, access controls, and role-based permissions in Snowflake
* Automate data ingestion from various sources using Snowflake connectors and external stages using different file format, code pages, and any integration with Saas tools (e.g. dbt cloud, Fivetran, Databricks etc).
* Rewrite and optimize Teradata SQL scripts, macros, and stored procedures for Snowflake compatibility.
* Develop reusable scripts for automation of migration tasks (Python, Shell etc.).
* Conduct data reconciliation between Teradata and Snowflake post-migration.
* Work closely with data architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand requirements.
* Document migration processes, best practices, and technical solutions.


**Technical Skills**
* Strong hands-on experience with Snowflake cloud data warehouse.
* Knowledge of Snowflake features: Time Travel, Cloning, Micro-partitions, Streams & Tasks.
* Hands on experience in Snowflake features like external stages, Snowpipe, storage integration, File Formats, RBAC etc
* Strong experience with SQL and various database technologies (Oracle, Teradata SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.).
* Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD practices for data pipelines and workflows.
* Experience in data engineering or database development, particularly with data migrations.
* Experience in different batch processing and data loading/transformation strategies.
* Proficiency in scripting for automating regular or repeating task (python, shell scripting etc).
* Understanding of Teradata architecture, SQL, and utilities (BTEQ, FastLoad, MultiLoad, TPT).
* Experience in analysing and converting Teradata-specific functions to Snowflake equivalents.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Snowflake SnowPro Certification is a plus
* Experience in banking and financial services will be preferred.

title: Area Tech Lead
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Area Tech Lead - Finansiera**
 Fortnox är på en resa för att bli Sveriges häftigaste FinTech-bolag, drivet av modern teknik och skalbara system. Vi vill bygga en utvecklingsorganisation i absolut världsklass och söker nu en Area Tech Lead som vill vara med på den resan och tekniskt forma nästa generation av våra produkter.
   

  

 Produktområde Finansiera tillhandahåller finansieringslösningar (Fakturaköp, Betala senare, Företagslån) till små och medelstora företag. Detta är ett av våra snabbast växande områden, vilket ställer höga krav på skalbarhet och arkitekturell kvalitet. Som Area Tech Lead kommer du att vara en nyckelperson för att säkerställa att vi möter dessa krav tekniskt.
   

  

**Ansvar**
* Tekniskt ansvarig för produktområdets leveranser, kvalitet och arkitektur.
* Ansvar för kontinuerlig teknisk förbättring, innovation och kunskapsspridning inom produktområdet.


**Uppgifter**
* Aktivt arbeta med kod för att kunna säkerställa relevanta och innovativa lösningar.
* Driva teknisk kompetensutveckling och vara mentor för utvecklare inom området.
* Agera tekniskt bollplank och stöd till områdets team.
* Arbeta nära områdets produkt- och designledare för att balansera tekniska förbättringar mot funktionsutveckling i områdets backlog.
* Utveckla, dokumentera och kommunicera en tydlig arkitekturell plan och teknisk strategi för området.
* Representera områdets teknik i samtal och möten med interna och externa parter.
* Leda tekniska intervjuer vid rekrytering.


**Kompetens / Erfarenhet**
* Högskoleexamen inom Datateknik, Mjukvaruteknik eller motsvarande
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av professionell mjukvaruutveckling, varav minst 3 år i en ledande teknisk roll, Tech Lead, Senior Developer, Arkitekt eller motsvarande.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att designa och implementera skalbara, distribuerade system.
* Erfarenhet av att framgångsrikt coacha och mentorera utvecklare och driva teknisk kompetensutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av Domain Driven Design (DDD) och dess tillämpning vid design och utveckling av distribuerade system.
* Erfarenhet av JVM-baserade språk i allmänhet och Kotlin i synnerhet är meriterande.
* Flytande svenska i såväl tal som skrift


**Fortnox - mitt i företagslivet**
*Fortnox hjälper företag att starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska lösningar för företag och redovisningsbyråer, smidig finansiering och ett ekosystem av starka partnerskap är Fortnox ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vi drivs av visionen om ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag.*
*Fortnox grundades 2001 med huvudkontor i Växjö. Läs mer på www.fortnoxgroup.com.*
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Key Account Manager - Aftermarket
description:
**Shape the future. Bring your potential to life.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people, and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 We are looking for an experienced Key Account Manager to lead and grow our aftermarket business across the Nordic market. This role requires a strategic, results-driven professional with a proven track record in sales development, negotiation, and account management. You will operate with a high degree of autonomy, driving business growth and building long-term partnerships with key customers.
   

  

 The Key Account Manager will work to expand our business, developing and creating new business opportunities with new and existing customers. The Key Account Manager will work as a business enabler and business developer owning our aftermarket products. The position is part of our Peace of Mind department, reporting to the Nordic Commercial Manager.
   

  

 In this role, you will take ownership of developing and executing aftermarket sales strategies to meet ambitious revenue and profitability goals across the region. You will lead complex negotiations with senior stakeholders, securing long-term agreements that deliver mutual value. By leveraging market intelligence and a deep understanding of customer needs, you will proactively identify and cultivate new business opportunities, driving impactful actions both internally and externally. Collaboration is key—you will work closely with marketing, operations, finance, supply chain and our own production site to ensure seamless delivery and outstanding customer experience.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Drive growth in spare parts, accessories, and service solutions.
* Manage and grow relationships with key accounts, ensuring customer satisfaction and loyalty.
* Provide input and feedback to product development teams based on customer insights and market trends.
* Monitor market trends and competitor activities to adapt strategies proactively.
* Report and forecast sales performance, providing actionable insights to senior management.


**Who you are:**
* Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in key account management, sales, or business development within aftermarket or related industry.
* Proven ability as a negotiator, with experience in complex deals.
* Strong business development skills with a pragmatic and structured approach to drive growth.
* Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Experience or strong interest in product development and aligning customer needs with product strategy.
* Excellent communication and relationship-building skills at all organizational levels.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.

title: Senior Security Engineer (Application Security)
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The Role**
 At Legora, we prioritise security. Always.
